text:
I may just be a yellow plastic bulldozer, but I take immense pride in my role at the bottom of Tommy's toy box. While the shiny action figures and trendy electronic games get all the attention up top, I'm the one who keeps this place organized. Every night, when Tommy's fast asleep, I push the scattered Legos into neat piles and clear paths through the chaos of discarded toys.

Sure, my paint is chipped, and one of my treads is a bit loose, but I've earned these battle scars. I've survived countless backyard excavations, living room construction sites, and even that time Tommy's little sister tried to flush me down the toilet. I'm built for durability, not glamour.

The other toys don't quite understand my dedication to order. The teddy bears mock my constant pushing and shoving, and the toy soldiers think I'm wasting my time. But they don't realize that without me, this toy box would be an impassable jungle of jumbled playthings.

Sometimes, I dream of the toy store where I came from, displayed proudly on the shelf with my fellow construction vehicles. But then I remember the joy in Tommy's eyes when he first unwrapped me on his fourth birthday, and I know this is where I belong.

Even though I spend most days now buried beneath newer, fancier toys, I know my worth. I'm not just a bulldozer â€“ I'm a keeper of order, a guardian of play space, and a beloved member of Tommy's toy family, even if he's forgotten me for now.
